Data Cleaning

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/clean.R
clean.Rd

Removes empty row/column or row/column with missing values or zeros.

replace_NA(x, ...)

remove_NA(x, ...)

remove_empty(x, ...)

remove_zero(x, ...)

# S4 method for matrix
replace_NA(x, value = 0)

# S4 method for DataMatrix
replace_NA(x, value = 0)

# S4 method for matrix
remove_NA(x, margin = 1, finite = TRUE)

# S4 method for DataMatrix
remove_NA(x, margin = 1, finite = TRUE)

# S4 method for matrix
remove_zero(x, margin = 1)

# S4 method for DataMatrix
remove_zero(x, margin = 1)

# S4 method for matrix
remove_empty(x, margin = 1)

# S4 method for DataMatrix
remove_empty(x, margin = 1)

Arguments

x

A matrix, data.frame or DataMatrix object.
...

Currently not used.
value

A possible value to replace missing values of x.
margin

An integer giving the subscript which the cleaning will be applied over (1 indicates rows, 2 indicates columns).
finite

A logical scalar: should non-finite values also be removed?

Author

N. Frerebeau

Examples

## Create a count data matrix
A <- CountMatrix(sample(1:10, 25, TRUE), nrow = 5, ncol = 5)
A[sample(1:25, 3, FALSE)] <- 0 # Add zeros
A

#> <CountMatrix: 5 x 5>
#>      col1 col2 col3 col4 col5
#> row1    5   10    9    6    8
#> row2   10    0    9    6    0
#> row3    6    4    3    9    8
#> row4    7    1    4    9    3
#> row5   10    4    0    4    7

## Remove row with zeros
remove_zero(A, margin = 1)

#> Removed 2 rows (zeros):
#> * row2 (2)
#> * row5 (1)
#> <CountMatrix: 3 x 5>
#>      col1 col2 col3 col4 col5
#> row1    5   10    9    6    8
#> row3    6    4    3    9    8
#> row4    7    1    4    9    3

## Remove column with zeros
remove_zero(A, margin = 2)

#> Removed 3 columns (zeros):
#> * col2 (1)
#> * col3 (1)
#> * col5 (1)
#> <CountMatrix: 5 x 2>
#>      col1 col4
#> row1    5    6
#> row2   10    6
#> row3    6    9
#> row4    7    9
#> row5   10    4
